term.name: intuitionism
term.source: From Latin intueri: to look upon, consider, contemplate.
term.def: The view (first associated with &platonism;) that all knowledge is gained through intuition, immediate insight, or spiritual vision of a transcendent reality.
The doctrine that ethical theories are best grounded in moral intuitions about what is right or good. Historically, intuitionism has tended to be associated with &deontologism;.
